dialogue.htmlContent:
#IF(pc.hasTraitActivated(PERK_CHUUNI))

Ready to embark upon your epic quest alongside your worthy rival, you strike a suitably impressive pose and declare to Meraxis that it's time to leave for Themiscyra. Jumping up to match your pose with one of her own, the Dark Siren dramatically declares, [meraxis.speech(The dark powers which have woven our fates together compel us to leave at once! Prepare yourself, my worthy rival, for I shall allow you to cross through space and time with me!)]

Realising that this means that Meraxis intends to teleport the two of you to the town, you prepare yourself and tell the [meraxis.race] in a suitably poetic manner that you're ready whenever she is. Turning to face the group of succubi who have attached themselves to her in the hopes of being able to bask in a fraction of her universe-shattering powers, Meraxis commands, [meraxis.speech(Remain here, my loyal minions! [pc.Name] and I must face our destiny alone, after which I shall return to regale you with tales of my magnificent victories!)]

With expressions of awe on their faces, these succubi look on in adoration as Meraxis casts the teleportation spell. A second later, and you find yourself momentarily blinded by a flash of pinkish-purple light...

#ELSE

Ready to set off on your quest to find out if Themiscyra is being threatened by Lunette's raiders, you tell Meraxis that you're ready to set out. Jumping up to strike a ridiculous pose, the chuuni [meraxis.race] dramatically declares, [meraxis.speech(The dark powers which have woven our fates together compel us to leave at once! Prepare yourself, my worthy rival, for I shall allow you to cross through space and time with me!)]

Realising that this means that Meraxis intends to teleport the two of you to the town, you try to ignore the giggles coming from the group of nearby succubi as you say that you're ready to go. Nodding in approval, Meraxis then turns to face these succubi, who have attached themselves to her in the hopes of being able to climb the social hierarchy by being associated with an elder lilin's recognised daughter, and commands, [meraxis.speech(Remain here, my loyal minions! [pc.Name] and I must face our destiny alone, after which I shall return to regale you with tales of my magnificent victories!)]

Trying not to smirk and giggle too much, these succubi sit back and watch as Meraxis casts the teleportation spell. A second later, and you find yourself momentarily blinded by a flash of pinkish-purple light...

#ENDIF

Opening your eyes, you see that you're now standing beside a curved section of a paved road, which is cutting through thick woodland. Standing beside you is Meraxis, and as she turns to face you, she lets out a laugh and boasts, [meraxis.speech(Mwhahaha! Behold my ultimate powers! In but a moment, I have transported us to the town of Themiscyra, home of the Amazons!)]

Looking around, you see no sign of this town, and so state this fact to the chuuni [meraxis.race]. Letting out an annoyed tut, she places her hands on her hips and retorts, [meraxis.speech(You'll be able to see the town as soon as we're around this bend. As much as I'd love to demonstrate my awesome arcane abilities to the Amazons, they take the security of Themiscyra very seriously, and if the two of us appeared out of thin air then we'd have a lot of explaining to do, which would ruinously detract from the spectacle of seeing how amazing I am.)]

#IF(pc.hasTraitActivated(PERK_CHUUNI))

With this level of caution being somewhat uncharacteristic for your rival, the Dark Siren, you strike a dramatic pose and demand to know why she's trying to be so careful around the Amazons. Not wanting to show weakness, the [meraxis.race] matches your pose with one of her own, before rhetorically asking, [meraxis.speech(You really don't know anything, do you? Well, I suppose that can't be helped, the Amazons do try to keep to themselves, after all. As you seem to know nothing about them, then the two main things to note are that they're a feminine-only community, and that they have a well-deserved reputation as being fearsome warriors. Of course, they stand no chance against my galaxy-shattering spells, but I do respect their prowess in combat, and so I'd rather avoid getting into a situation where I have to fight them.)]

Wanting to regain the initiative, you state that it'd be best to get moving, before asking Meraxis which way it is to the town. Still in her dramatic pose, she points down the road and declares, [meraxis.speech(This way, my rival! Follow me!)]

Setting off in the indicated direction alongside Meraxis, you soon turn the corner in the road, and as you do so, you start to notice that there's the faint smell of burning in the air. A moment later, you see plumes of smoke rising up into the sky above the treetops in the distance. Noticing this at the same time as you, the grin drops from Meraxis's face, and she gasps, [meraxis.speech(We're too late! Come on, [pc.name]! Hurry!)]

#ELSE

With this level of caution being somewhat uncharacteristic for Meraxis, you ask her why she's trying to be so careful around the Amazons. Letting out a sigh and crossing her arms, she rhetorically asks, [meraxis.speech(You really don't know anything, do you? Well, I suppose that can't be helped, the Amazons do try to keep to themselves, after all. As you seem to know nothing about them, then the two main things to note are that they're a feminine-only community, and that they have a well-deserved reputation as being fearsome warriors. Of course, they stand no chance against my galaxy-shattering spells, but I do respect their prowess in combat, and so I'd rather avoid getting into a situation where I have to fight them.)]

Thinking that it'd be best to get moving, you ask Meraxis which way it is to the town. Striking another of her dramatic poses, she points down the road and declares, [meraxis.speech(This way, my rival! Follow me!)]

Setting off in the indicated direction alongside the chuuni [meraxis.race], you soon turn the corner in the road, and as you do so, you start to notice that there's the faint smell of burning in the air. A moment later, you see plumes of smoke rising up into the sky above the treetops in the distance. Noticing this at the same time as you, the grin drops from Meraxis's face, and she gasps, [meraxis.speech(We're too late! Come on, [pc.name]! Hurry!)]

#ENDIF

The prospect of finding Themiscyra under attack and in need of assistance serves to drive you and Meraxis on as you hurry as fast as you can down the road. Turning one last corner, you exit the forest and find yourself standing upon a small hill, the elevation of which grants you a good view over the town of Themiscyra and its surrounding landscape.

Momentarily pausing to assess the situation, you see that the main road upon which you're travelling gently snakes its way through dozens of fields, before going beneath a huge triumphal arch which sits at the town's main entrance. The fields which lie between you and the town have been thoroughly trampled, scorched, and blasted full of smoking craters, leading you to assume that this was the recent site of a large battle. Surprisingly, given the scale of the destruction, you don't see any casualties, nor for that matter any sign of people at all. Casting your gaze over this battleground, you look at the town itself, which appears to be almost as large as Elis, although with buildings constructed in a classical Greek style instead of medieval European architecture. On the far side of the town, you see a large, rocky outcropping, with a classical palace perched upon the top.

[meraxis.speech(Where is everybody?)] Meraxis asks, having also noticed that there's nobody to be seen anywhere. Pointing at the plumes of smoke rising from within the town, she concludes, [meraxis.speech(The fighting must be going on in there! Come on, [pc.name], maybe we can help!)]

As the two of you hurry towards the town, you realise that you're not hearing any sounds of conflict within. Worried by this, Meraxis laments, [meraxis.speech(It sounds like we're too late...)]

Managing to cross the fields in good time, within a few minutes the two of you are approaching the triumphal entrance arch. As you draw near, you see your first sign of life since arriving, which not only reveals what's happened to Themiscyra, but causes you and Meraxis to come to a halt and prepare yourselves for a fight. Loudly laughing and boasting, this worrying sign of life takes the form of at least a dozen huge, muscular, demonic centauresses, who come trotting out from the town carrying bags of loot over their shoulders or upon their backs. Caught up in their conversation, they don't notice you at first, but as they draw a little nearer, the leader at the front sees you and shouts out a warning cry, which causes the group to heft their axes, swords, and spears, and then begin to charge right at you.

Not at all intimidated or scared at the prospect of being trampled by these centauresses, Meraxis allows a mischievous smirk to settle on her face as she steps forwards and holds her hand up into the air. With a flash of light, her huge, green-bladed scythe appears in her outstretched hand, after which she spins completely around in a theatrical manner to assume a dramatic pose. With her free hand she then lifts up her eyepatch, revealing her glowing, heterochromatic purple eye as she declares, [meraxis.speech(Behold! My potential unchained! Now you shall know true power!)]

Without asking for your permission, or even telling you what she's planning, the chuuni [meraxis.race] teleports the two of you to beneath the triumphal arch, right behind the group of charging centauresses. Skidding to a halt, the demons let out angry, confused shouts as they see the two of you vanish into thin air. With deception clearly not playing a critical part in her plan, Meraxis lets the group know where she is by slamming the base of her scythe against the floor and loudly shouting, [meraxis.speech(Powers beneath the earth, obey your Mistress's command! Rend unto the end of time a chasm of darkness, from which the suffocating miasma of toxic dimensions may pour forth!)]

#IF(pc.hasTraitActivated(PERK_CHUUNI)) Recognising that Meraxis is casting the same spell which she used back in her citadel, you smirk to yourself as you realise that you're once again going to be able to witness your rival's awesome power. #ELSE Recognising that Meraxis is casting the same spell which she used back in her citadel, you try to tell her to tone it down this time, but your warning comes too late. #ENDIF The ground starts to violently shake beneath your [pc.feet], which causes several of the centauresses to trip and fall, before fissures begin to open up and spew forth choking, arcane-draining gasses. Looking up, you see that the arch, already weakened due to a large chunk of masonry having been blown out of the rear side of it, has several deep and highly-worrying cracks spreading across its surface. As you shout out a warning to the chuuni [meraxis.race], you see the arch begin to collapse from the seismic forces, causing you to push Meraxis forwards to safety and then dive back to avoid being crushed!

Thanks to your warning, Meraxis sees the danger at the same time as you, and with your push giving her the boost she needed, she manages to dash forwards and dodge the falling masonry. Falling back the opposite way, your retreat takes you into Themiscyra, splitting you up from Meraxis in the process. Over the ear-splitting noise of the arch's collapse, you think that you hear the [meraxis.race] shouting for you to make your way to the palace, before a flash of light lets you know that she's safely teleported out of there.

With the angry centauresses now cut off from your position by a mountain of hazardous rubble, you turn your back on the collapsed arch and prepare to set off on your way to the palace. Knowing that Meraxis is more than capable of looking after herself, you decide not to rush, and look out for any more aggressive demons who might have been attracted by the noise as you prepare to enter the town. Thankfully, although several nearby buildings are on fire, and there are more signs of fighting and destruction everywhere you look, no more demonic centauresses can be seen.

[aurokaris.speech(Halt and identify yourself!)] a strong, feminine voice suddenly shouts out off to your side. Turning to face the source of this voice, you see a muscular, greater cow-girl, who stands at [aurokaris.heightValue] and who looks to be around twenty, aggressively pointing a spear in your direction. Her hazel eyes are narrowed as she tries to figure out whether you're friend or foe, and from the stance she's taking, you can tell that she knows how to fight.

Realising that this cow-girl is an Amazon, you see no harm in doing as she asks, and so stop to give her your name. After you've spoken, the Amazon takes a moment to decide whether or not to trust your word, during which time you're able to take a better look at her. The shaggy fur covering her body is a uniform brown, #IF(game.isFurryHairEnabled()) her long, braided hair is the same colour but a darker shade, and #ELSE while #ENDIF the long, curved horns growing out of her forehead are white. Her upper legs and torso, including her huge, [aurokaris.cupSize]-cup breasts, are covered by a peplos, an ancient-Greek style dress, which is worn in combination with several pieces of silver jewellery.

[aurokaris.speech(You don't act like Lunette's daughters,)] the cow-girl says as she lifts her spear. Although she has a kind-looking face, she continues to keep her eyes narrowed in suspicion as she asks, [aurokaris.speech(Before I can trust you, I need to know why you're here.)]

Telling the Amazon the truth, you explain how you arrived here with Meraxis, and that the two of you were sent by Minotallys to see if Themiscyra was being threatened by Lunette. Leaving out the part where it was your companion's fault, you say that the arch collapsed during your fight with a dozen demonic centauresses, and that during that demolition the two of you have become separated.

[aurokaris.speech(So Minotallys finally decided to do something,)] the Amazon sighs, before gesturing around at the burning and destroyed buildings and continuing, [aurokaris.speech(As you can see, it's too little, too late. We've been fending off raids from Lunette's daughters for months. Although every Amazon is a warrior, we've been constantly losing ground due to their strength and numbers. Now it looks like all is lost...)]

Seeing in this Amazon a potential ally, you tell the cow-girl that you'll be able to convince Minotallys to help, and that the town can surely be rebuilt.

[aurokaris.speech(You're right, there's no reason to lose hope just yet,)] she replies in a determined tone. Stepping forwards, the muscular cow-girl finally introduces herself, [aurokaris.speech(My name is Aurokaris. Although I'm one of the younger Amazons, our queen, Ursa, has put her faith in me. I've been tasked to make sure that the town had been fully evacuated while she holds back the main force of Lunette's army. She's fighting alongside our best warriors in front of the palace as we speak. I couldn't find any Amazons left behind, so I'm ready to head back to the palace now. If you join me and assist our queen, then she'll be able to speak of what's happened here and help you to convince Minotallys of Lunette's threat. It'll be safer to travel together.)]

Agreeing with Aurokaris's statement, you tell her that you'd be glad to have her come with you as you travel through the town. Saying that Meraxis is also to be found at the palace, you tell the cow-girl that you were planning on heading over there anyway, even before you knew that Ursa was still fighting there.

[aurokaris.speech(I saw some of Lunette's daughters as I made my way back here,)] Aurokaris warns, [aurokaris.speech(If we encounter any, then it should be easy enough to evade them, but if you'd like to fight, then I'll be at your side. Come on, there's no time to waste. Let's get going!)]

Agreeing that speed is of the essence, you set off into Themiscyra with the cow-girl Amazon at your side...

A short distance away from your current position lies the home of the Amazons; the town of Themiscyra. Having been attacked and mostly destroyed by the army commanded by Lunexis, the settlement now lies abandoned and in a state of ruin. The section of main road upon which you're standing is positioned upon a small hill, and from this elevated vantage point you're able to get a good view over the surrounding landscape.

The road's paved surface snakes its way down the hill and then through dozens of fields, before ending at the huge pile of rubble which was once the town's triumphal arch that straddled the town's main entrance. The fields which lie between you and the town have been scarred by Lunexis's attack, and are thoroughly trampled, scorched, and blasted full of smoking craters. Casting your gaze over this battleground, you look at the town itself, which appears to be almost as large as Elis, although with buildings constructed in a classical Greek style instead of medieval European architecture. On the far side of the town, you see a large, rocky outcropping, with a classical palace perched upon the top. Almost all of the buildings have been significantly damaged, either by fire or from the blasts of arcane spells.

Having been picked clean first by Lunette's daughters and then by daring scavengers, you know that there's nothing of value left in the town. With nothing to be gained from wandering through the desolate streets, you decide to continue on your way elsewhere...

Wanting to know more about this town and the situation you find yourself in, you stop and say to Aurokaris that you'd like to ask her some questions.

[aurokaris.speech(We don't have time for this,)] she impatiently replies, but then after letting out a deep sigh, she relents and says, [aurokaris.speech(I suppose information might help us in the fights to come. Very well, ask away, but please do try to be quick.)]

With the cow-girl scanning your surroundings to make sure that two of you aren't taken by surprise, you wonder what to ask her first...

Not having any more questions to ask, you tell Aurokaris that you're ready to continue on your way.

[aurokaris.speech(Great,)] the muscular Amazon replies as she hefts her dory, [aurokaris.speech(We need to find Ursa as quickly as possible. Let's get going!)]

Not wanting to delay your progress any further, you do as the cow-girl suggests and set off on your way through Themiscyra...

Wanting to know more about this town, you ask Aurokaris what she knows about Themiscyra and how it came into being.

[aurokaris.speech(We really don't have time for a history lesson here, but if it somehow helps in the fight, then I can give you a quick summary,)] the cow-girl replies in frustration. After glancing about to make sure that you're safe, she starts, [aurokaris.speech(This town was founded many generations ago by a pair of bear-girl sisters, who wanted to create a community in which only feminine people were allowed. It's known that the reason for this is that the sisters wanted to please Lilith, as they assumed that Lilith only approves of the feminine form. This part of Themiscyra's history has been getting more controversial recently, seeing as how it's one of Lilith's daughters who's been responsible for our woes.)]

Wanting to know more, you ask Aurokaris if Lilith had anything directly to do with creating this town.

[aurokaris.speech(No, there's no recorded history of Lilith or any of the lilin having anything to do with our town. Well, until recently that is,)] she replies with a sad gesture to the ruined buildings around you. Wanting to disassociate her home from Lilith, she hastily explains, [aurokaris.speech(Themiscyra has grown and changed over the past few hundred years, and so while we Amazons still honour the founding law of only allowing feminine citizens, we scrapped mandatory Lilith worshipping and voluntary tributes to Dominion a long time ago. After Lunette's daughters started harassing us and raiding our lands, public opinion has rapidly shifted to view our founding sisters in a very negative light.)]

Glancing around once again, Aurokaris hefts her spear and impatiently asks, [aurokaris.speech(Is that all? Can we please get going now? Ursa may need our help!)]

With the cow-girl clearly desperate to get moving again, you wonder whether to bring your questioning to an end, or to ask something else first...

Curious about the topic of the Amazons themselves, you ask Aurokaris what she can tell you about the habits and customs of her people.

[aurokaris.speech(Well, as is commonly known, we're a community of all-feminine warriors,)] she replies, [aurokaris.speech(Anyone can present themselves to us and ask to join, but they must be feminine in appearance, and willing to undergo rigorous physical and martial training. Every Amazon is required to attend combat training, the purpose of which is to keep ourselves fit and able to fend off attacks by raiders, bandits, and... well... Lunette's daughters.)]

Pausing for a moment, Aurokaris allows a sad expression to settle on her face, before shaking it off and brusquely stating, [aurokaris.speech(There's no time for this. Let's get going!)]

The cow-girl is obviously keen to be on her way, but you think that you could get away with asking another question or two...

Needing to know more about the person who you're on the way to find, you ask Aurokaris what she can tell you about Ursa, the queen of the Amazons.

[aurokaris.speech(Ursa? She's kind, brave, just, intelligent, and the best warrior in all of Themiscyra!)] Aurokaris gushes, before forcing herself to take on a more serious tone and continue, [aurokaris.speech(That is to say, she's in the running for the best queen the Amazons have ever had. Under her reign, all aspects of life have been improving, and we Amazons have never been fitter or more ready for combat. Even so, it clearly wasn't enough...)]

For a moment, you see a despondent, melancholy look in the cow-girl's eyes, but before you can say anything to try to shake her out of it, she recovers and finishes by revealing, [aurokaris.speech(Ursa is a descendant of the two sisters who founded Themiscyra hundreds of years ago. There's no hereditary monarchy here, and instead the queen is chosen every two years by tests of strength, martial prowess, intelligence, and leadership abilities. Ursa has won the past ten contests, and we Amazons love her so much that there's never any serious objection to her continued rule.)]

Having come to the end of her speech, Aurokaris suddenly seems to recall the situation you're in, and impatiently asks, [aurokaris.speech(Is that all? Can we please get going again now?)]

Wanting to find out how this current situation unfolded, you ask Aurokaris how Lunette launched this attack, and how all of Themiscyra came to be evacuated.

[aurokaris.speech(We were taken by surprise,)] Aurokaris reveals through gritted teeth, [aurokaris.speech(Our scouts have always been able to warn of incoming attacks in the past, but this time was different. It happened about eight or so hours ago now; there was a huge purple flash, then suddenly hundreds of demonic centauresses were charging across the fields and fighting their way into the town. We had no time to raise the alarm or prepare for the assault. The Amazons on guard duty put up a valiant resistance, but they couldn't hold so many demons back, and so we were quickly overrun.)]

Gesturing to the deserted street and surrounding buildings, you ask what happened to all of the residents.

[aurokaris.speech(Thankfully, Ursa was quick to call for a complete evacuation,)] the cow-girl replies, [aurokaris.speech(If it wasn't for that decisive action, then I'm sure many Amazons would be bound in chains right about now. Most Amazons fled into the surrounding Foloi Forest, but many others, myself included, rushed to the palace to defend our queen.)]

Noting that there's a conspicuous lack of demonic centauresses, you ask where Lunette's army has gone.

[aurokaris.speech(I saw several small groups break off from their main force to start looting and torching the town, but the vast majority of Lunette's army has gone to the palace to find and defeat my queen,)] she answers, [aurokaris.speech(I was fighting alongside her and several dozen Amazons in the plaza before the palace, but Ursa realised that against such overwhelming numbers we couldn't hold forever. That's why my queen commanded me to go and check that the town had been evacuated so that we could retreat without leaving anyone behind. Having done that, I need to return to the palace as quickly as possible!)]

Impatiently hefting her dory, the cow-girl is clearly eager to be on her way to assist her queen, but she could probably endure being asked another question or two...

Gesturing towards the huge pile of rubble, you ask Aurokaris what she knows about the triumphal arch which now lies in ruins.

[aurokaris.speech(It was built long before my time,)] she replies, [aurokaris.speech(but I do know that it was erected in honour of the athletes we sent to a prestigious sports contest. We Amazons won the most gold medals, and so this arch was built in recognition of that. I didn't see how it was destroyed, but hopefully once all of this is over, we can rebuild it...)]

Thinking that now is probably not the best time to mention how exactly the arch came to be reduced to a pile of rubble, you wonder whether to continue on your way to the palace, or ask Aurokaris another question first...

Thinking that Aurokaris might know something about how these barricades came into being, you ask her if she had anything to do with their construction.

[aurokaris.speech(I didn't have time to stop and help, but I saw other Amazons throwing them up under the directions of Ursa soon after the warning bell was sounded,)] she replies, [aurokaris.speech(It looks like some of our arcane-proficient Amazons set them on fire after they were built. I guess they'll keep on burning for hours...)]

Thanking the cow-girl for the information, you wonder what to do next...

With you and Aurokaris having defeated a couple of demonic centauresses in this area, you ask the cow-girl what she thinks they were looking for in this area to loot.

[aurokaris.speech(I suppose they wanted flames, weapons, or anything of value. They wouldn't have found much though, I'm sure. We Amazons are rather spartan, and don't allow ourselves many luxuries or comforts,)] she replies, before motioning towards the jewellery she's wearing and the dory she's carrying and explaining, [aurokaris.speech(We carry most of the wealth we own in the form of jewellery and weapons, and so there's not much to steal from our homes. Anyway, we don't have time talk right now, we need to get to Ursa.)]

Thanking Aurokaris for the information, you wonder whether to do as the cow-girl suggests and continue on your way to find Ursa, or to ask her another question first...

Wondering if Aurokaris can tell you anything interesting about these smithies, you ask her if she ever came here to purchase anything.

[aurokaris.speech(This is where all the Amazons came to buy their weapons and armour,)] she replies, before holding up her spear and pointing to a nearby building. [aurokaris.speech(I bought this very dory from that weaponsmith right there. I got my armour from the place next door to it, but I didn't have time to go home and get it on. I suppose it's been stolen by now...)]

With your curiosity satisfied, you wonder what to ask the cow-girl next...

Wanting to know more about these warehouses, you ask Aurokaris why there are so many wine merchants in Themiscyra.

[aurokaris.speech(There are many unspoken rules and customs among the Amazons,)] she begins, [aurokaris.speech(and one of them is that indulging oneself in luxurious food and drink is a sign of weakness. The only drinks which are considered suitable for Amazonian warriors are water and wine. As such, there's a huge demand for wine, so there needed to be a large industry to meet that demand.)]

Thanking the cow-girl for the information, and with the nearby burning buildings making this a slightly uncomfortable place in which to stop and talk, you decide against asking any further wine-related questions and wonder what to do next...

Wanting to know more about these workshops, you ask Aurokaris if she ever purchased anything from here.

[aurokaris.speech(Of course,)] she replies, before gesturing to her earrings, bangle, ring, and barrette, all of which are silver. Having shown off her jewellery, she says, [aurokaris.speech(I purchased all of these from the workshops here. This was the place everyone would go to buy their jewellery.)]

Curious to know if all Amazons share Aurokaris's fondness for jewellery, you ask the cow-girl if this was a particularly busy part of the town.

[aurokaris.speech(Oh, yes,)] she replies in a positive tone, [aurokaris.speech(Fashionable dresses and fancy outfits are considered to be a sign of weakness by the Amazons, so instead of buying lots of clothes, we collect jewellery. We don't place much value on the material, and instead we're always on the lookout for exceptional examples of craftsmanship. Jewellery is one of only two luxuries which are tolerated in Themiscyra, the other being wine, so this courtyard was always busy.)]

Thanking her for the information, you wonder whether to ask anything else of Aurokaris, or to instead continue on your way...

Looking around at your ruined and vandalised surroundings, which all begin to look the same after a while, you ask Aurokaris if she knows this area well.

[aurokaris.speech(Yes, I know all of Themiscyra very well,)] she replies with a distinct note of sadness in her voice. Looking over at a nearby building that's now nothing more than a pile of rubble, she sighs, [aurokaris.speech(I used to pass by this place multiple times a day when I was on guard duty. I never imagined that this could happen...)]

Not wanting to keep the cow-girl dwelling on depressing thoughts about the present situation, you refrain from asking anything else about your current location and wonder what to do next...

A huge pile of dangerously unstable rubble is all that's left of the gigantic triumphal arch which once stood at the main entrance to Themiscyra. The buildings to either side of where you're standing haven't entirely escaped the effects of Meraxis's spell either, for you see worryingly-large cracks running through their stone frontages.

[aurokaris.speech(We shouldn't linger here for long,)] Aurokaris comments, [aurokaris.speech(Those buildings look like they might collapse at any moment.)]

Seeing the wisdom in the cow-girl's words, you take one last look at the sorry mountain of rubble, before preparing to set off into the town...

The streets of Themiscyra are strikingly similar to renditions you remember seeing of the city states of ancient Greece. Classical architecture is the theme of every building you pass, and there seems to be no shortage of green spaces and marble plazas. The paved roads are flanked by trees, arcane-powered lights, and simple stone benches. Were you visiting at any other time, you're sure that Themiscyra would have been a wonderful place to be, but as it is, the place looks well on its way to being reduced to rubble.

Many of the buildings which you pass look to have been blasted by arcane spells, as they either have large holes punched through them, or have been partially torn down. Every now and then, you have to hurry past a building that's on fire, and you and Aurokaris try to hold your breath as you rush through the thick smoke which billows forth from these burning structures. Chunks of masonry, splintered wood, and shattered roof tiles are strewn across every street, while many of the trees, lampposts, and benches which you pass have been vandalised in one way or another.

Come and see me at our camp if ever you need anything.)]

With that, Lunexis, Ursa, and Aurokaris disappear down the spiral staircase, leaving you, Meraxis, Minotallys, and Arion to take care of the planning for Lunette's arrival...

Now that the issue of what to do with Lunexis has been dealt with, you ask Minotallys and Arion what kind of preparations could be made to get Elis as ready as possible for the battle against Lunette.

Clearly not having the head for this kind of thing, Minotallys looks up at Arion for guidance. Taking a moment in which to think, the unicorn-boy suggests, [arion.speech(We should probably get help from some professionals. We just so happen to have some extremely experienced Enforcers here in Elis who'll know a thing or two about fighting and, if it gets to that stage, about being under siege.)]

Catching on to what Arion means, the cow-girl lilin asks, [minotallys.speech(Oh, do you mean that SWORD unit which was sent here about five years ago?)]

[arion.speech(That's right,)] Arion replies, before explaining to you, [arion.speech(The Enforcers we're talking about saw a lot of action during the Fifth Human Rebellion back in the late eighties. Yes, before you ask, that does mean that they're at retirement age, but as far as I know there's nobody else in town with anywhere near as much real combat experience. Also, from what I remember when I read their records, they've gone up against high-ranking demons and even lilin in the past. We can trust them.)]

[meraxis.speech(If they're so good, why aren't they working in Dominion? That's where all the top Enforcers end up,)] Meraxis asks in a weak voice.

[minotallys.speech(Politics,)] Minotallys explains in a single word. Waving her hand in a gesture to imply that she finds such things tiresome, she goes on to explain, [minotallys.speech(They got on the wrong side of an elder lilin, and as they couldn't be dealt with by other means without a terrible scandal, they were demoted and assigned here to Elis.)]

[meraxis.speech(So we need to get the help of these Enforcers, then they can advise us on how to defend this town against Lunette?)] Meraxis asks.

[arion.speech(I think that's our best bet,)] Arion replies. Looking at you, he asks, [arion.speech(Can we ask you to do this, [pc.name]? Minotallys and I have much to do for the Amazons. They need water, food, and medical assistance, and we've got to get all of that organised as quickly as possible. I'd ask Meraxis to help too, but it looks like she's about to faint.)]

Looking over at the [meraxis.race], you see that Arion is right. Her skin is looking alarmingly pale, her eyelids keep drooping, and she's swaying from side to side as she tries her best to remain standing. After quickly agreeing to take on the task of heading over to Elis's Enforcer station and recruiting the assistance of these Enforcer veterans, you tell Meraxis that she needs to head back to The Red Dragon and get some rest.

[meraxis.speech(I'm the most powerful demon ever to exist,)] she mumbles, [meraxis.speech(but I have no energy... Don't take this as a sign of weakness, my rival, but can you please help me down the stairs?)]

Needing Meraxis back at full strength as quickly as possible, you tell Minotallys and Arion that you'll get the Enforcer's help as quickly as possible, before helping the chuuni [meraxis.race] out of the office and down the stairs.

[meraxis.speech(I command you to forget about this,)] Meraxis weakly orders as you continue to support her all the way to the town hall's exit. Accepting your help in the relative privacy of the town hall was one thing, but as you [pc.step] out into the streets of Elis, Meraxis blushes and weakly pushes you away, before mumbling, [meraxis.speech(This repays your debt to me for saving you back there in Themiscyra... I can make it back to the tavern by myself now... I'll catch up with you later...)]

Knowing that her pride won't allow her to accept any more of your assistance, you watch Meraxis walk off in the direction of The Red Dragon, before wondering what to do next...
